instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
Board is in perfect condition. No drop or liquid damage. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is shorted at 0.47. When injecting voltage the only component that gets hot is L7260. Removed but short is still there.

What should be checked next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> short
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is shorted at 0.47"
Do you mean diode mode, or ohm scale?
0.47 in ohm scale is short for sure.
0.47 in diode mode is around 1 kohm...
Please post accurate information.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS and <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> short
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
"yes, diode mode"
Why did you assume is short then???

Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> (voltages).
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
On a working board the measurement was 0.318

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.60v

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  3.42v

<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> 3.42V

Yes <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
0.318 is lower, how could 0.47(0) be short???

Post <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> voltages; pins 16, 3, 13, 8, 17, 1, 6.
Also post diode mode readings at L7220/60.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> short
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> short
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7200</CHIP> changed

pin 16 12.60V

pin 3 2.009V

pin 13 3.4V

pin 8 03.3 V

pin 17 4.97V

pin 1 0v

pin 6 0.839v

L7220 0.120

L7260 0.128

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
You should get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> now.
Also check <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>.
Check for pulse at L7260 when you trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.
